title: Do outpatients feel they were given enough information about their treatment or condition?
analysis_commentary: The proportion of outpatients reporting that they had the right amount of information about their condition or treatment was similar to inpatients and varied between 80% and 83%. In 2011 this was at its highest of 83%, this was a significant change from 2009 and suggests an improvement in the amount of information provided for outpatients. Although it is not an answer category in the Adult Inpatient Survey, for outpatients the proportion who felt they weren't given any information or not enough information has decreased over time. Interestingly, 0% of outpatients reported being given too much information in all years.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Survey of Adult Inpatients and Survey of Outpatients
